quiz.title: Unit 5: Perfect Competition (Quiz 1)
quiz.subtitle: AP Microeconomics — Characteristics, Profit Max, Short-Run & Long-Run Equilibrium
quiz.subject: AP Microeconomics
quiz.topic: Perfect Competition Assumptions, Price Taker, MR = MC, Profit/Loss, Shutdown Rule, Long-Run Entry/Exit, Productive & Allocative Efficiency

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of a perfectly competitive market?
options: Free entry and exit in the long run.
questions.explanation: In perfect competition, products are homogeneous (identical), not differentiated.

questions.question: In a perfectly competitive market, the demand curve faced by an individual firm is:
questions.explanation: A perfectly competitive firm is a price taker; it can sell any quantity at the market price, so its demand curve is perfectly elastic (horizontal).

questions.question: For a perfectly competitive firm, marginal revenue (MR) is equal to:
options: Marginal cost (MC) at all output levels.
questions.explanation: In perfect competition, MR = P because each additional unit sold adds exactly the market price to total revenue.

questions.question: A perfectly competitive firm will maximize profit by producing the quantity where:
questions.explanation: Profit is maximized where MR = MC. In perfect competition, this is where P = MC.

questions.question: In the short run, a perfectly competitive firm should shut down if:
options: Price is less than average total cost.
Price is less than average variable cost.
Price is less than marginal cost.
Total revenue is less than total fixed cost.
questions.explanation: Shutdown rule: P < AVC. If price doesn’t cover variable costs, the firm minimizes losses by shutting down.

questions.question: Suppose a perfectly competitive firm is producing where P = MC and P > ATC. This firm is:
questions.explanation: If P > ATC at the profit-maximizing output, the firm earns economic profit.

questions.question: In long-run equilibrium in a perfectly competitive market, firms earn:
questions.explanation: Free entry and exit drive economic profit to zero in the long run; firms earn only normal profit.

questions.question: When new firms enter a perfectly competitive market in the long run, the market supply curve shifts _____, and the market price _____.
questions.explanation: Entry increases supply (shifts right), lowering market price until economic profit is eliminated.

questions.question: In long-run competitive equilibrium, which condition must hold?
questions.explanation: Long-run equilibrium requires P = MR = MC = ATC at the minimum of ATC (zero economic profit).

questions.question: Which of the following best describes allocative efficiency in perfect competition?
options: Producing at the minimum of ATC.
questions.explanation: Allocative efficiency occurs where P = MC, meaning resources are allocated to produce the quantity where marginal benefit equals marginal cost.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent mastery of perfect competition theory — ready for FRQs.
scoreMessages.70: Strong grasp; review shutdown rule and long-run adjustment process.
scoreMessages.50: Fair; revisit firm vs. market demand, profit max condition, and efficiency concepts.
scoreMessages.0: Needs review: perfect competition assumptions, short-run decisions, long-run equilibrium.
